Palladium - Individual Market Analysis

CoT signals and diagnostics for Palladium futures.

As of 2025-11-04

Gemini Summary

State of the Market Summary:

  • Palladium saw significant short covering by both speculators and hedgers over the last four weeks [Source: Palladium_CoT_Signals.html].
  • Speculators are net short -4.60% OI, while hedgers are net short -3.20% OI as of 2025-11-04 [Source: Palladium_CoT_Signals.html].
  • Hedgers exhibit a persistent "Deep Short" regime, indicating sustained covering or accumulation [Source: Palladium_CoT_Signals.html].

Technical Summary:

  • Speculative positioning shows a stretched long-side z-score of 1.7064, relative to their overall net short stance [Source: Palladium_CoT_Signals.html].
  • Hedgers are similarly stretched short at a -1.6026 z-score, despite being net short overall [Source: Palladium_CoT_Signals.html].
  • The market currently shows no signs of crowding, squeeze risk, or exhaustion risk, with a reversal score of 0 [Source: Palladium_CoT_Signals.html].

References:

  • Palladium_CoT_Signals, latest update 2025-11-04 [Source: Palladium_CoT_Signals.html].
  • Key data points influencing conclusions were Spec_Net_%OI, Hedger_Net_%OI, Spec_zscore, Hedger_zscore, and Flow_4w.
  • Industrial demand forecasts for Palladium [Source: global_trade_demand_group] would improve future analysis.
  • Real interest rate trend signals [Source: Real_Interest_Rate_Trend_Signal.html] would also enhance the analysis.
**Self-healing** * High-Value Inputs to Add: * Industrial demand forecasts for Palladium [Source: global_trade_demand_group] would contextualize positioning changes. * Real interest rate trend signals [Source: Real_Interest_Rate_Trend_Signal.html] could inform investment demand shifts. * Weaknesses in Provided Inputs: * Clarify `Flow_4w` calculation for individual speculator and hedger groups; the current aggregate `Long_Build` is ambiguous. * Ensure all data columns (e.g., `Market and Exchange Names`, `CFTC Contract Market Code`) are consistently populated across all data sources (e.g., `disaggregated` vs `legacy`). * Prompt Gaps or Issues: * Clarify if RSS feed analysis is expected when no RSS feed content is explicitly provided in the input, despite the self-healing instructions.
